citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Strategic Assessment Branch (OAD)
citeinfo.title: Arctic Marine Computer Mapping and Analysis System

descript.abstract: The (CMAS:BCB) package is a computer-based mapping and analysis system that displays, in an interactive mode, temporal and spatial information for all living marine resources addressed in the publication; "Bering, Chukchi, and Beaufort Seas Coastal and Ocean Zones Strategic Assessment Data Atlas." It has been developed for use on Macintosh-type computer systems and is designed for easy use/rapid update of distribution, abundance, and utilization information for individual species and species groups such as invertebrates, fishes, birds, and mammals.
descript.purpose: This computerized, interactive atlas represents a compendium of Arctic marine information (through 1986) from a variety of sources. As an electronic "publication" it is easily updated. This results in a dynamic document that is conveniently located on a researcher's or manager's desk.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
